text:
The install-include target in the main Makefile includes the line
@chmod 644 $(DESTDIR)$(includedir)/*.h
By default, this chmod's all headers in /usr/include.  This is a minor change,
but  is, for instance, noted when determining which files have status changed by
installation.  Apache shouldn't mess with other system files ;-)  More
importantly, as all includes are installed with cp -p, and all currently
installed includes have mode already set to 644, this is unnecessary.

I will include a patch against the latest CVS below.
creator: chjones@aleph0.com
chjones@aleph0.com
text:
Created attachment 11364
Remove chmod from install-include

This is only an issue if your Layout doens't put the Apache headers in their own directory... The default 
will put them safely inside /usr/local/apache2/include
creator: chip@force-elite.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
Or you naively use --includedir=/usr/include when configuring.  Regardless, this
is a bug.  The Makefile needs to be fixed to use $(INSTALL_DATA) rather than cp
for this and other reasons.

Fixed on the trunk, http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs?rev=189585&view=rev

Probably not worth a backport to 2.0; I'd consider that using
"--includedir=/usr/include" is a shot-yourself-in-the-foot situation anyway.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
